The Bride and Groom

Sydnee

I was born in Great Falls, Montana. Moved around a little bit when I was younger to New Mexico and Florida and landed back here in Montana when I was going into 4th grade.


I was involved in sports like volleyball, basketball, cheerleading, and many other extracurricular activities. I graduated high school at Centerville in 2016 and went to college for a year as I had gotten a cheerleading scholarship with the University of Great Falls (University of Providence).


I was hoping that as I continued to be in college while cheerleading that my dream occupation would expose itself, but nothing sounded good to me. I stopped going to college and worked at various jobs, from a grocery store, to a dog boarding facility, to landscaping, to finally landing in the Great Falls Clinic, which is where I have been working for the past year and a half.


I also started selling Scentsy in December of 2020 which has been an amazing experience. Some of my hobbies include camping, hiking, traveling, and being around any and all dogs.

Jake

I was born in Bozeman, Montana and moved to Great Falls when I was about 1 year old. I went to public school until 4th grade and then homeschooled from then until I graduated high school. I graduated Class of 2014 from Christian Liberty Academy out of Illinois.


I did many programs in 4-H as long as I can remember. Dog, archery, and Junior Leader camps were my jam in 4-H. I also helped when needed at livestock shows and sales.


My first job was boarding K9 drug detective dogs for a family friend and slowly moved to lawn mowing and plumbing during the summer. I landed a sweet job at FedEx Ground in 2014 where I worked my way up to manager.


I have been in Montana all my life and proud to call it my home. I currently enjoy working on my '78 Chevy truck, camping/hiking, backroading, and bonfires with friends.

Countdown to the Wedding

Our Love Story

  • First Met

    We first met at Centerville's Prom in 2014 where we slowly grew a friendship, only hanging out when mutual friends invited us around to back roading, bonfires, or going to Dairy Queen.

    March 30, 2014

  • First Date

    There was a length of time where we stopped communicating and stopped crossing paths as much, but sometime in 2015, is when our friendship really started to flourish. We started talking every day, from the time we would wake up to the time we would go to sleep. We slowly started to hang out more one on one, meeting in the Walmart parking lot to go on little drives around Great Falls or going to get ice cream. Everyone noticed that we were getting closer and kept asking when we were going to start dating. It was something that we both denied for months. But finally, on March 27, 2016, we finally realized that we wanted to be more than friends

    March 2016

  • Proposal

    Event 3 Description

    April 4, 2020

We are going to...
